title: Context-Dependent Memory: Where You Learn Matters
description: A quick, practical guide to Context-Dependent Memory: Where You Learn Matters.

hook.text: Scuba divers who learned words underwater recalled them better underwater than on land.

buildup.text: The environment where you encode information becomes part of the memory trace itself.

twist.text: Studying in the same room where you'll take the test improves scores measurably.

climax.text: Varying study locations creates more retrieval paths, making memories more flexible.

punchline.text: Change where you study and your brain builds more roads to the answer.
